title: How to Beat the Atari at Centipede

steps.headline: Move around.
steps.description: Moving around helps. If the last part of the Centipede is at the bottom, move until it floats back up! But watch out for the spiders and bugs that fly and drop!

steps.headline: Hit the red button almost all the time.
steps.description: Remember, if you hit the button quickly and move all the time, you can kill the Centipede and move to the next color and Centipede.

steps.headline: Use your dexterity.
steps.description: This is a video game, so it requires 100% dexterity. Your thumb may throb and swell, but it's worth it!

steps.headline: Try your best.
steps.description: If you try hard, you can win greatly. Some people have it in their blood. Others can't do it. But the old motto says If at first you don't succeed, try, try, again.

steps.headline: Be patient.
steps.description: Rome wasn't built in a day, it took months or years to build. It takes a lot of time to do it. Believe me, I took time, and it helped!

steps.headline: Practice, practice, practice.
steps.description: It can take weeks or months of practice and time to win at Centipede.

tyn: A TV, VCR, or DVD to plug into
Video and Audio plugs, yellow and white.
text: Move around. Moving around helps. If the last part of the Centipede is at the bottom, move until it floats back up! But watch out for the spiders and bugs that fly and drop! Hit the red button almost all the time. Remember, if you hit the button quickly and move all the time, you can kill the Centipede and move to the next color and Centipede. Use your dexterity. This is a video game, so it requires 100% dexterity. Your thumb may throb and swell, but it's worth it! Try your best. If you try hard, you can win greatly. Some people have it in their blood. Others can't do it. But the old motto says If at first you don't succeed, try, try, again. Be patient. Rome wasn't built in a day, it took months or years to build. It takes a lot of time to do it. Believe me, I took time, and it helped! Practice, practice, practice. It can take weeks or months of practice and time to win at Centipede.
